1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
3{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
4{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
5
6-- | Tree structure.
7
8module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Tree
9  ( -- * Raw tree
10    RawTree (..),
11    treeHeight,
12    treeListY, treeListZ, treePaths,
13    treeMap, treeMapY, treeMapZ,
14    undouble,
15    partitionLB,
16
17    -- * Print tree
18    ppRawTree, ppRawTrees,
19    printTree, printTrees,
20
21    -- * Code tree
22    CodeTree,
23    codeTree, codeTrees,
24    codeTreeWrap,
25    codeTreeFmap,
26    untree, untrees,
27  ) where
28
29import qualified Data.List                             as Ls
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort            as B
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude          as B
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Bracket     as B
34import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Message     as Msg
35
36
37-- ============================================  Tree
38
39-- | Tree of leaf and branch.
40data RawTree b y z
41    = TreeL z
42      -- ^ __Leaf:__ Leaf element (@z@).
43    | TreeB b y [RawTree b y z]
44      -- ^ __Branch:__ Branch type (@b@), branch element (@y@), and subtrees.
45      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
46
47instance Functor (RawTree p k) where
48    fmap = treeMapZ
49
50-- | Height of tree.
51--
52--   >>> treeHeight $ TreeB () "Y1" [TreeL "Z1", TreeL "Z2", TreeB () "Y2" [TreeL "Z3"]]
53--   3
54--
55treeHeight :: RawTree b y z -> Int
56treeHeight (TreeL _)      = 1
57treeHeight (TreeB _ _ xs) = 1 + maximum (treeHeight <$> xs)
58
59-- | Collect branch elements.
60--
61--   >>> treeListY $ TreeB () "Y1" [TreeL "Z1", TreeL "Z2", TreeB () "Y2" [TreeL "Z3"]]
62--   ["Y1","Y2"]
63--
64treeListY :: RawTree b y z -> [y]
65treeListY (TreeB _ y xs)  = y : (treeListY O.<++> xs)
66treeListY (TreeL _)       = []
67
68-- | Collect leaf elements.
69--
70--   >>> treeListZ $ TreeB () "Y1" [TreeL "Z1", TreeL "Z2", TreeB () "Y2" [TreeL "Z3"]]
71--   ["Z1","Z2","Z3"]
72--
73treeListZ :: RawTree b y z -> [z]
74treeListZ (TreeB _ _ xs)  = treeListZ O.<++> xs
75treeListZ (TreeL z)       = [z]
76
77-- | Convert tree to path list.
78--
79--   >>> treePaths $ TreeB () "Y1" [TreeL "Z1", TreeL "Z2", TreeB () "Y2" [TreeL "Z3"]]
80--   [(["Y1"],"Z1"), (["Y1"],"Z2"), (["Y1","Y2"],"Z3")]
81--
82treePaths :: RawTree b y z -> [([y], z)]
83treePaths = path [] where
84    path p (TreeB _ y xs)  = path (y : p) O.<++> xs
85    path p (TreeL z)       = [(reverse p, z)]
86
87-- | Map function to tree elements.
88treeMap :: (b1 -> b2) -> (y1 -> y2) -> (z1 -> z2) -> RawTree b1 y1 z1 -> RawTree b2 y2 z2
89treeMap bmap ymap zmap = loop where
90    loop (TreeL z)       = TreeL (zmap z)
91    loop (TreeB b y xs)  = TreeB (bmap b) (ymap y) (loop <$> xs)
92
93-- | Map function to branch element.
94treeMapY :: (y1 -> y2) -> RawTree b y1 z -> RawTree b y2 z
95treeMapY f = loop where
96    loop (TreeL z)       = TreeL z
97    loop (TreeB b y xs)  = TreeB b (f y) (loop <$> xs)
98
99-- | Map function to leaf element.
100treeMapZ :: (z1 -> z2) -> RawTree b y z1 -> RawTree b y z2
101treeMapZ f = loop where
102    loop (TreeL z)       = TreeL (f z)
103    loop (TreeB b y xs)  = TreeB b y (loop <$> xs)
104
105-- | Simplify tree by removing double brackets,
106--   like @((a))@ to @(a)@.
107--
108--   >>> undouble (== 0) $ TreeB 0 Nothing [TreeB 0 Nothing [TreeL "A", TreeL "B"]]
109--   TreeB 0 Nothing [TreeL "A", TreeL "B"]
110-- 
111undouble :: O.Test b -> O.Map (RawTree b y z)
112undouble p = loop where
113    loop (TreeB n pp xs) | p n =
114        case map loop xs of
115          [x] -> x
116          xs2 -> TreeB n pp xs2
117    loop x = x
118
119-- | Divide branch into leaves and branches.
120partitionLB :: [RawTree b y z] -> ([RawTree b y z], [RawTree b y z])
121partitionLB = Ls.partition isTreeL
122
123isTreeL :: RawTree b y z -> Bool
124isTreeL (TreeL _)      = True
125isTreeL (TreeB _ _ _)  = False
126
127-- ============================================  Print tree
128
129-- | Convert single raw tree to printable lines.
130--   Branches are marked usign right arrow (@>@),
131--   and leaves are marked using hyphen (@-@).
132--
133ppRawTree :: (Show b, Show y, Show z) => RawTree b y z -> [String]
134ppRawTree = pp 0 where
135    pp dp (TreeL z)      = [indent dp ++ "- " ++ show z]
136    pp dp (TreeB b y xs) = (indent dp ++ "> " ++ show b ++ " " ++ show y)
137                           : (pp (dp + 1) O.<++> xs)
138    indent 0  = ""
139    indent dp = replicate (2 * dp) ' '
140
141-- | Convert multiple raw trees to printable lines.
142ppRawTrees :: (Show b, Show y, Show z) => [RawTree b y z] -> [String]
143ppRawTrees = concatMap ppRawTree
144
145-- | Pretty print raw tree.
146--
147--   >>> printTree $ TreeB () "Y1" [TreeL "Z1", TreeB () "Y2" [TreeL "Z2", TreeL "Z3"]]
148--   Height of tree      = 3
149--   Number of branches  = 2
150--   Number of leaves    = 3
151--   .
152--   > () "Y1"
153--     - "Z1"
154--     > () "Y2"
155--       - "Z2"
156--       - "Z3"
157--
158printTree :: (Show b, Show y, Show z) => RawTree b y z -> IO ()
159printTree tree =
160    do putStrLn $ "Height of tree      = " ++ show (treeHeight tree)
161       putStrLn $ "Number of branches  = " ++ num treeListY
162       putStrLn $ "Number of leaves    = " ++ num treeListZ
163       O.putLn
164       putStrLn O.<#!> ppRawTree tree
165       O.putLn
166    where
167      num f = show (length $ f tree)
168
169-- | Pretty print raw trees.
170printTrees :: (Show b, Show y, Show z) => [RawTree b y z] -> IO ()
171printTrees = mapM_ printTree
172
173
174-- ============================================  Code tree
175
176-- | Tree with open/close brackets.
177type CodeTree b a = RawTree b (Maybe (a, a)) a
178
179instance (B.GetCodePos a) => B.GetCodePos (CodeTree p a) where
180    getCPs t = B.getCP <$> untree t
181
182-- | Mapping function for 'CodeTree'.
183codeTreeFmap :: (a -> b) -> CodeTree p a -> CodeTree p b
184codeTreeFmap f = loop where
185    loop (TreeL x)                   = TreeL $ f x
186    loop (TreeB n Nothing xs)        = TreeB n Nothing $ map loop xs
187    loop (TreeB n (Just (x, y)) xs)  = TreeB n (Just (f x, f y)) $ map loop xs
188
189-- | Convert code elements to a single code tree.
190codeTree :: (Ord b, B.GetCodePos a) => B.GetBracket b a -> B.Bracket b -> b -> [a] -> B.Ab (CodeTree b a)
191codeTree bracketType zero one =
192    Right . codeTreeWrap one B.<#.> codeTrees bracketType zero
193
194-- | Convert code elements to code trees.
195codeTrees :: forall a. forall b. (Ord b, B.GetCodePos a)
196    => B.GetBracket b a         -- ^ Bracket definition
197    -> B.Bracket b              -- ^ 'B.BracketNone'
198    -> [a]                      -- ^ List of code elements
199    -> B.Ab [CodeTree b a]      -- ^ Result code trees
200codeTrees bracketType zero xs = result where
201    result       = do (ts, _) <- loop xs zero
202                      Right ts
203    add xs2 p a  = do (ts, xs3) <- loop xs2 p
204                      Right (a : ts, xs3)
205
206    loop :: [a] -> B.Bracket b -> B.Ab ([CodeTree b a], [a])
207    loop [] _ = Right ([], [])
208    loop (x : xs2) p
209        | isNone px  = add xs2 p $ TreeL x
210        | isOpen px  = do (trees2, cxs3) <- loop xs2 px
211                          case (px, cxs3) of
212                            (B.BracketOpen p2, c : xs3)
213                              -> add xs3 p $ TreeB p2 (Just (x, c)) trees2
214                            _ -> ab Msg.extraOpenBracket
215        | isClose px  = Right ([], x : xs2)
216        | otherwise          = ab Msg.extraCloseBracket
217        where px  = bracketType x
218              ab  = Msg.abCode [x]
219
220    isNone (B.BracketNone)     = True
221    isNone _                   = False
222
223    isOpen (B.BracketOpen _)   = True
224    isOpen _                   = False
225
226    isClose (B.BracketClose _) = True
227    isClose _                  = False
228
229-- | Wrap trees into single tree.
230codeTreeWrap :: b -> [CodeTree b a] -> CodeTree b a
231codeTreeWrap _   [x] = x
232codeTreeWrap one xs  = TreeB one Nothing xs
233
234-- | Convert tree to list of tokens.
235untrees :: [CodeTree b a] -> [a]
236untrees = concatMap untree
237
238-- | Convert tree to list of tokens.
239untree :: CodeTree b a -> [a]
240untree = loop where
241    loop (TreeL x) = [x]
242    loop (TreeB _ Nothing xs) = loop O.<++> xs
243    loop (TreeB _ (Just (open, close)) xs) =
244        open : (loop O.<++> xs) ++ [close]
245
